content: 1 © christine bateman 2023 catswhiskerscrochet@gmail com play with light and shade colour and texture to create this pretty afghan block 2 important information - please read before beginning although not essential an understanding of techniques such as magic_ring standing stitches and invisible closure of rounds would be an advantage look at what i made is an excellent source of information and techniques where a new round continues in the same colour you can follow the instructions for moving between the rounds as given or you may prefer to ignore them and fasten_off and rejoin for a neat finish see next tip and see link above instructions are not given on how to begin and end single rounds each time for the neatest finish begin the rounds except the first with a standing stitch and fasten_off invisibly using a tapestry needle otherwise replace the first stitch of each round with the appropriate number of chain e g chain-1 for single_crochet chain- 2 for half_double_crochet chain-3 for double_crochet etc and fasten_off with a slip_stitch any substitute chains must always be counted as a stitch the magic_ring can be replaced by 3 or 4 chain joined into a loop with a slip_stitch important instructions in bold type tips and explanations in red italics abbreviations us terms r round double_crochet double_crochet chain chain treble_crochet triple treble crochet st stitch/es flo front loop only slip_stitch slip_stitch blo back loop only single_crochet single_crochet fpsc front post single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet bpdc back post double_crochet skill level intermediate or confident beginner materials small quantities of yarn in white and 3 closely shaded colours light medium and dark appropriate hook for yarn tapestry needle stitch markers measurements 10 in dk with a 4 or 4 5mm hook 12 in worsted weight with a 5 or 5 5mm hook 3 r1 white 16 double_crochet chain-3 + 15 double_crochet into magic_ring or chain loop join with a slip_stitch in gap between chain-3 and first double_crochet do not cut yarn the slip_stitch just made counts as the last st of this round 16 double_crochet r2 white take care the stitch you will work into after each fpsc is partially hidden and may be closer than you think and the stitch you will work into after each single_crochet is further away don t confuse the post of the next stitch with the one you have just worked into fpsc around next st single_crochet in next st repeat from beginning all around join with a slip_stitch in second stitch the single_crochet do not cut yarn 8 single_crochet 8 fpsc this round along with several others will probably pull your work in but later rounds will even things out r3 white before you start carefully drop yarn loop from hook insert hook into next stitch from front to back and pull dropped loop through to front chain-3 double_crochet in same st at base of chain = 2 double_crochet 2 double_crochet in each following st don t miss the last one join with a slip_stitch
